ACLED_Notes: On 24 November 2024, at night, Russian military forces carried out massive 'Shahed' drone strikes at unspecified targets in the Kyiv region. According to local sources, the drone debris damaged an industrial enterprise in the Kyiv region. Casualties unknown. Also, at night, Ukrainian air defense forces shot down in total 50 attack drones over the multiple locations, some over the Kyiv region (coded to Kyiv city, Kyiv region). Also, 19 Russian drones were lost likely due to Ukrainian EW systems. 4 more Russian attack drones were still on combat operations in the airspace.

UNESCO_Site: Kyiv: Saint-Sophia Cathedral and Related Monastic Buildings Kyiv-Pechersk Lavra
ACLED_Notes: On 25 November 2024, Ukrainian Forces intercepted Russian drones over Kyiv region. The debris of the downed drones damaged a private property, several cars and 4 houses. No casualties.

UNESCO_Site: Kyiv: Saint-Sophia Cathedral and Related Monastic Buildings Kyiv-Pechersk Lavra
ACLED_Notes: On 26 November 2024, Russian Forces launched a record number of drones against Ukraine - 188 Shahed and other unspecified drones (suspectedly decoy drones). Ukrainian Forces intercepted 76 drones, some of them over Kyiv region (coded to Kyiv, Kyiv). 95 more Russian drones were lost in Ukrainian airspace suspectedly due to Ukrainian electronic warfare (EW) interference. the fallen debris of the downed drones damaged 4 houses, 2 apartment buildings, an outbuilding, 2 garages and a car in Kyiv region. No casualties.

UNESCO_Site: Kyiv: Saint-Sophia Cathedral and Related Monastic Buildings Kyiv-Pechersk Lavra
ACLED_Notes: Interception: On 28 November 2024, Ukrainian forces shot down Russian Kh-101 missiles and Shahed drones above Kyiv, Kyiv City.

UNESCO_Site: Kyiv: Saint-Sophia Cathedral and Related Monastic Buildings Kyiv-Pechersk Lavra
ACLED_Notes: On 29 November 2024, Ukrainian military forces intercepted 88 Russian kamikaze-drones across several locations, some over the Kyiv region (coded to Kyiv, Kyiv City). The drones' debris damaged a residential property and outbuilding. There were no casualties.

UNESCO_Site: Kyiv: Saint-Sophia Cathedral and Related Monastic Buildings Kyiv-Pechersk Lavra
ACLED_Notes: Interception: On 1 December 2024, Ukrainian forces shot down Russian drones over Kyiv region (coded to Kyiv).

UNESCO_Site: Kyiv: Saint-Sophia Cathedral and Related Monastic Buildings Kyiv-Pechersk Lavra
ACLED_Notes: Interception: On 2 December 2024, Russian Forces launched 110 Shahed drones and other unidentified drone types at targets in Ukraine. Ukrainian Forces intercepted 52 drones, some of them over Kyiv region (coded to Kyiv, Kyiv). 50 more Russian drones were lost in Ukrainian airspace suspectedly due to Ukrainian electronic warfare (EW) interference. No casualties.

UNESCO_Site: Kyiv: Saint-Sophia Cathedral and Related Monastic Buildings Kyiv-Pechersk Lavra
ACLED_Notes: On 3 December 2024, Ukrainian Forces intercepted 22 Russian drones, some of them over Kyiv region (coded to Kyiv, Kyiv). The fallen debris of the downed drones damaged 4 houses, gas pipelines and 2 cars. No casualties.

UNESCO_Site: Kyiv: Saint-Sophia Cathedral and Related Monastic Buildings Kyiv-Pechersk Lavra
ACLED_Notes: Interception: On 3 December 2024, Ukrainian Forces intercepted 22 Russian drones, some of them over the Kyiv region (coded to Kyiv city). No casualties.

UNESCO_Site: Kyiv: Saint-Sophia Cathedral and Related Monastic Buildings Kyiv-Pechersk Lavra
ACLED_Notes: Around 4 December 2024 (as reported), Russian authorities returned the body of a Ukrainian mayor captured by the Russian forces in the Zaporizhzhia region at the start of the full-scale invasion to Ukraine (coded to Kyiv). The man died in Russian captivity under mysterious circumstances. According to Ukrainian officials, he might have been tortured to death.

UNESCO_Site: Kyiv: Saint-Sophia Cathedral and Related Monastic Buildings Kyiv-Pechersk Lavra
ACLED_Notes: Property destruction: Around 4 December 2024 (as reported), according to the SBU, prosecutors, and the police, a previously-convicted 33-year-old set fire to a relay cabinet near a railway station in the city of Kyiv, following promises of money from Russians.

UNESCO_Site: Kyiv: Saint-Sophia Cathedral and Related Monastic Buildings Kyiv-Pechersk Lavra
ACLED_Notes: Interception: On 5 December 2024, Ukrainian forces engaged Russian Shahed drones above Kyiv Oblast (coded as Kyiv, Kyiv City.) More than 12 Russian drones were shot down near or around Kyiv. 30 Russian drones were intercepted above Kharkiv, Poltava, Sumy, Chernihiv, Cherkasy, Kirovhrad, Zhytomyr, Kyiiv, Vinnytsia, and Khmelnytsky Oblasts. 12 drones disappeared and 1 disappeared near or in Belarus.

UNESCO_Site: Kyiv: Saint-Sophia Cathedral and Related Monastic Buildings Kyiv-Pechersk Lavra
ACLED_Notes: Property destruction: On 5 December 2024, a 26-year-old previously convicted man set fire to police vehicles in the city of Kyiv in revenge for police arresting him for curfew violation.

UNESCO_Site: Kyiv: Saint-Sophia Cathedral and Related Monastic Buildings Kyiv-Pechersk Lavra
ACLED_Notes: On 6 December 2024, Russian drones attacked Kyiv, Kyiv City. The Ukrainian military intercepted 32 drones across multiple locations, some over the Kyiv region. Drones' debris damaged residential property, a garage and outbuildings. There were no casualties.

UNESCO_Site: Kyiv: Saint-Sophia Cathedral and Related Monastic Buildings Kyiv-Pechersk Lavra
ACLED_Notes: On 7 December 2024, Russian forces launched a Shahed drone strike at Kyiv region (coded to Kyiv, Kyiv region). While Ukrainian air defence forces intercepted drones, several houses and vehicles were damaged by the falling debris. No casualties.

UNESCO_Site: Kyiv: Saint-Sophia Cathedral and Related Monastic Buildings Kyiv-Pechersk Lavra
ACLED_Notes: Interception: On 8 December 2024, Ukrainian forces shot down Russian drones over Kyiv region (coded to Kyiv).

UNESCO_Site: Kyiv: Saint-Sophia Cathedral and Related Monastic Buildings Kyiv-Pechersk Lavra
ACLED_Notes: Property destruction: Around 10 December 2024, according to the SBU, two men, aged 17 and 20, set fire to a military pickup undergoing repair in the city of Kyiv, following Russian commands. The men were quickly arrested.

UNESCO_Site: Kyiv: Saint-Sophia Cathedral and Related Monastic Buildings Kyiv-Pechersk Lavra
ACLED_Notes: Interception: On 12 December 2024, Ukrainian forces engaged Russian drones above Kyiv Oblast (coded to Kyiv, Kyiv City.)

UNESCO_Site: Kyiv: Saint-Sophia Cathedral and Related Monastic Buildings Kyiv-Pechersk Lavra
ACLED_Notes: On 13 December 2024, Ukrainian military forces intercepted Russian drones and missiles over Kyiv region (coded to Kyiv, Kyiv City). The debris damaged residential buildings. There were no casualties.

UNESCO_Site: Kyiv: Saint-Sophia Cathedral and Related Monastic Buildings Kyiv-Pechersk Lavra
ACLED_Notes: On 14 December 2024, Russian forces launched a drone strike at Kyiv region (coded to Kyiv, Kyiv region). Ukrainian air defence forces intercepted about 10 drones, but the falling debris in the Darnytskyi district damaged an enterprise and warehouses, causing a fire. Casualties unknown.

UNESCO_Site: Kyiv: Saint-Sophia Cathedral and Related Monastic Buildings Kyiv-Pechersk Lavra
ACLED_Notes: Interception: On 15 December 2024, Ukrainian forces shot down Russian drones over Kyiv region (coded to Kyiv).

UNESCO_Site: Kyiv: Saint-Sophia Cathedral and Related Monastic Buildings Kyiv-Pechersk Lavra
ACLED_Notes: Weapons seizure: Around 15 December 2024 (month of), according to the Security Service of Ukraine, the SBU arrested a 16-year-old man who was planting an explosive device outside a military unit in the Kyiv region (coded to Kyiv). The explosive device was prepared by two women recruited by Russian services and who handed the explosive to the man.

UNESCO_Site: Kyiv: Saint-Sophia Cathedral and Related Monastic Buildings Kyiv-Pechersk Lavra
ACLED_Notes: Defusal: Around 15 December 2024 (month of), the Security Service prevented the explosion of an explosive device planted by a 16-year-old man near a military unit in the Kyiv region (coded to Kyiv). The man was following Russian commands and likely involved a 19-year-old man and 2 other women preparing the explosives.

UNESCO_Site: Kyiv: Saint-Sophia Cathedral and Related Monastic Buildings Kyiv-Pechersk Lavra
ACLED_Notes: On 19 December 2024, debris from Russian drones crashed into a private home and onto train tracks on Kyiv, Kyiv City. The home was damaged. No casualties.

UNESCO_Site: Kyiv: Saint-Sophia Cathedral and Related Monastic Buildings Kyiv-Pechersk Lavra
ACLED_Notes: Interception: On 19 December 2024, Ukrainian forces engaged Russian drones and missiles above Kyiv Oblast (coded as Kyiv, Kyiv City.) 45 Shahed drones and drones of other types were shot down above Poltava, Sumy, Kharkiv, Kyiv, Khmelnytskyi, Chernihiv, Cherkasy, Kirovohrad, Dnipropetrovsk, and Mykolaiv. 40 other drones were interdicted with electronic warfare systems and lost.

UNESCO_Site: Kyiv: Saint-Sophia Cathedral and Related Monastic Buildings Kyiv-Pechersk Lavra
ACLED_Notes: On 20 December 2024, Russian Kindzhal and Iskander missiles attacked Kyiv, Kyiv City. 1 civilians was killed, 13 wounded (1 killed and 2 wounded coded to the specific event in Kyiv - Holosiivskyi).

UNESCO_Site: Kyiv: Saint-Sophia Cathedral and Related Monastic Buildings Kyiv-Pechersk Lavra
ACLED_Notes: Interception: On 20 December 2024, Ukrainian military forces intercepted 40 Russian kamikaze-drones over multiple locations, some over the Kyiv region (coded to Kyiv, Kyiv City).

UNESCO_Site: Kyiv: Saint-Sophia Cathedral and Related Monastic Buildings Kyiv-Pechersk Lavra
ACLED_Notes: Property destruction: On 11 January 2018, unidentified individuals set fire to a car in Kiev belonging to the head of an initiative group for public control over the investigation into the murder of human rights activist Iryna Nozdrovska. The fire spread to another car parked nearby. No injuries were reported.

UNESCO_Site: Kyiv: Saint-Sophia Cathedral and Related Monastic Buildings Kyiv-Pechersk Lavra
ACLED_Notes: Other: On 18 January 2018, Ukraine's parliament in Kiev has passed a bill on de-occupation of Donbas region. The supporters of the bill, including President Poroshenko, say it will help Kyiv restore control over areas in the east that are held by Russia-backed separatists. The bill defines Donetsk and Luhansk regions as 'temporarily occupied territories', contrary to the autonomy granted to them in the Minsk agreement, and labels Russia as 'aggressor'.

UNESCO_Site: Kyiv: Saint-Sophia Cathedral and Related Monastic Buildings Kyiv-Pechersk Lavra
ACLED_Notes: On 25 January 2018, Ukraine presented the first cyber security centre in Kiev, strengthening its capacity to combat cyber crime. The centre was opened thanks to cooperation with Nato and the SBU.

UNESCO_Site: Kyiv: Saint-Sophia Cathedral and Related Monastic Buildings Kyiv-Pechersk Lavra
ACLED_Notes: On 26 January 2018, in Kyiv, an additional 50 Canadian servicemen have arrived in Ukraine to train the country's troops as part of the UNIFIER mission, Lt. Col. Kristopher Reeves, commander of the Canadian army's Joint Task Force-Ukraine stated.

UNESCO_Site: Kyiv: Saint-Sophia Cathedral and Related Monastic Buildings Kyiv-Pechersk Lavra
ACLED_Notes: On 7 February 2018, in Kiev, members of the National Corps attacked two men who were planning to distribute 'antifascist' leaflets. The victims claimed to be members of the Communist Party from western Ukraine.

UNESCO_Site: Kyiv: Saint-Sophia Cathedral and Related Monastic Buildings Kyiv-Pechersk Lavra
ACLED_Notes: On 8 February 2018, a journalist was injured after gas was dispersed in the Vesti office as the National Agency for Identifying, Tracing and Managing Assets Obtained through Corruption and Other Crimes took control of the editorial offices of the Vesti newspaper in Kiev. This was done under criminal proceedings against the former minister for taxes and levies, who is accused of corruption.

UNESCO_Site: Kyiv: Saint-Sophia Cathedral and Related Monastic Buildings Kyiv-Pechersk Lavra
ACLED_Notes: On 12 February 2018, State Border Guards detained Mikheil Saakashvili, the leader of the New Forces Movement Party in Ukraine and ex-president of Georgia while he was dining in a restaurant in Kiev. Saakashvili faces extradition.

UNESCO_Site: Kyiv: Saint-Sophia Cathedral and Related Monastic Buildings Kyiv-Pechersk Lavra
ACLED_Notes: On 16 February 2018, 2018 Police Forces of Ukraine seized over 100 improvised explosive devices, bottles with an unidentified flammable substance, and a large amount of marijuana during the searches at the home of one Kiev resident.

UNESCO_Site: Kyiv: Saint-Sophia Cathedral and Related Monastic Buildings Kyiv-Pechersk Lavra
ACLED_Notes: On 21 March 2018, an Azerbaijani journalist was attacked at his residence in Kiev by unknown persons, which resulted in several injuries.

UNESCO_Site: Kyiv: Saint-Sophia Cathedral and Related Monastic Buildings Kyiv-Pechersk Lavra
ACLED_Notes: Other: On 30 March 2018, Ukraine has expelled 13 Russian diplomats from the territory of the country in connection with a nerve gas attack against former double agent Sergei Skripal and his daughter Yulia in Salisbury on March 4 [coded to Kiev].

UNESCO_Site: Kyiv: Saint-Sophia Cathedral and Related Monastic Buildings Kyiv-Pechersk Lavra
ACLED_Notes: Weapons seizure: Around 20 April 2018, the Security Service of Ukraine exposed an organized group in Kiev that established the illegal export of weapons and ammunition from the ATO area. During the investigation it was established that former members of one of the volunteer battalions sent weapons and parts of ammunition for assembling and manufacturing in one of the workshops in Kiev to be used for further re-sale in the capital region and to members of criminal circles throughout Ukraine. The SBU seized four anti-tank grenade launchers, 30 grenades, two large-calibre projectiles, three kilograms of plastid, three detonators, six rifles, three automatic weapons, 37 pistols and traumatic guns and almost 15,000 ammunition rounds.

UNESCO_Site: Kyiv: Saint-Sophia Cathedral and Related Monastic Buildings Kyiv-Pechersk Lavra
ACLED_Notes: Weapons seizure: Around 20 April 2018 (as reported), the Security Service of Ukraine stopped the activities of an international group that supplied weapons to Ukraine from Europe and the United States. During the investigation it was established that a resident of Kiev had established a channel for the supply of spare parts for pistols and automatic devices which were brought into Ukraine by couriers and later assembled in workshops for use in combat. The SBU seized three machine guns, three assault rifles, two rifles, seven submachine guns, 30 pistols and revolvers, eight grenade launchers, 32 grenades, five mines, 3,240 ammunition rounds and assembly kits pistols.

UNESCO_Site: Kyiv: Saint-Sophia Cathedral and Related Monastic Buildings Kyiv-Pechersk Lavra
ACLED_Notes: Weapons seizure: On 1 May 2018, Ukrainian law enforcers have discovered a package with arms and ammunition on Trukhaniv Island in Kiev which contained four grenades, detonators, five TNT blocks, 10 projectiles for a grenade launcher, five cartridges for a rifle and about 1,500 rounds of ammunition.

UNESCO_Site: Kyiv: Saint-Sophia Cathedral and Related Monastic Buildings Kyiv-Pechersk Lavra
ACLED_Notes: Security measures: On 8 May 2018, the Security Service of Ukraine carried out searches at home of the Ukrainian Communist Party leader Petro Symonenko in Kiev and recovered campaign leaflets calling for constitutional change or government overthrow or takeover, and seized items looking like a Stechkin pistol with a silencer and 120 cartridges. Symonenko had been summoned for questioning as part of a criminal inquiry into 'actions aimed at violent change or overthrow of the constitutional system or seizure of government power' and 'high treason,' according to the SBU spokeswoman Olena Hytlyanska. Later in the day SBU officers raided the homes of senior Communists in and around Kyiv and recovered campaign materials containing banned Communist symbols.

UNESCO_Site: Kyiv: Saint-Sophia Cathedral and Related Monastic Buildings Kyiv-Pechersk Lavra
ACLED_Notes: On 17 May 2018, unidentified individuals attacked a Donbas veteran in Kiev who had become famous for his travel blog, in particular, after he published a video of arguing with and spitting in the face of a pro-Kremlin Russian journalist. The victim sustained injuries to his head.

UNESCO_Site: Kyiv: Saint-Sophia Cathedral and Related Monastic Buildings Kyiv-Pechersk Lavra
ACLED_Notes: On 30 May 2018, in Kiev, Ukrainian authorities detained a Ukrainian citizen, Borys Herman, accused of being recruited by Russia's secret services to organize a murder plot against self-exiled Russian reporter and Kremlin critic Arkady Babchenko. Ukraine's Security Service (SBU) says it thwarted the planned killing by working together with Babchenko to fake his death. Ukrainian authorities also said a total of up to 30 people in Ukraine had been targeted for killing as part of the alleged Russian plot. Both SBU officials and Babchenko have defended their decision to fake Babchenko's death - rejecting criticism from reporters and journalism advocates who warned that it has undermined the credibility of law enforcement agencies and independent media organizations.

UNESCO_Site: Kyiv: Saint-Sophia Cathedral and Related Monastic Buildings Kyiv-Pechersk Lavra
ACLED_Notes: Around 21 June 2018 (between 18 June - 24 June), more than 20 LGBT activists and volunteers of the March of Equality were assaulted and beaten in Kiev.

UNESCO_Site: Kyiv: Saint-Sophia Cathedral and Related Monastic Buildings Kyiv-Pechersk Lavra
ACLED_Notes: Property destruction: On 6 August 2018, unidentified individuals tried to break into the house of a TV journalist and her parents outside Kiev by breaking the door, however fled when neighbours called the police. One of the attackers was identified as a member of a Chechen criminal group and was placed on the wanted list.

UNESCO_Site: Kyiv: Saint-Sophia Cathedral and Related Monastic Buildings Kyiv-Pechersk Lavra
ACLED_Notes: Weapons seizure: On 15 August 2018, in Kiev, law enforcers uncovered an arms cache in a garage cooperative, belonging to a former Kiev-2 battalion serviceman, with a large quantity of firearms, ammunition and explosives.

UNESCO_Site: Kyiv: Saint-Sophia Cathedral and Related Monastic Buildings Kyiv-Pechersk Lavra
ACLED_Notes: On 6 September 2018, The head of the National Police, Serhiy Knyazyev, has said that Russia arms rebels in east Ukraine with weapons seized during the annexation of Crimea. Over these four years, police have registered 60 cases of seizing Crimean weapons from rebels, including 51 assault rifles, 15 pistols, two grenade launchers and one carbine. Police have opened a criminal case against the Russian Federation according to Part 2, Article 438 of the Criminal Code on using internationally illegal warfare methods.

UNESCO_Site: Kyiv: Saint-Sophia Cathedral and Related Monastic Buildings Kyiv-Pechersk Lavra
ACLED_Notes: On 26 October 2018, unidentified individuals attacked a member of Radical Party near his house in Kiev. They broke his nose and jaw and caused him a concussion. The party connects the attack to the victim's protest activity.

UNESCO_Site: Kyiv: Saint-Sophia Cathedral and Related Monastic Buildings Kyiv-Pechersk Lavra
ACLED_Notes: As reported on Nov. 28 2018, in Kiev, the Security Service of Ukraine uncovered an organised group, which was assembling and illegally selling weapons, and seized 8 illegal firearms. Members of the group included a National Guard serviceman who was arrested.

UNESCO_Site: Kyiv: Saint-Sophia Cathedral and Related Monastic Buildings Kyiv-Pechersk Lavra
ACLED_Notes: On Nov. 29 2018, after the arrest of the Ukrainian blogger Oleksandr Baraboshko in Kiev, Ukraine, members of the military prosecutor's office inflicted light bodily injuries on him and tried to obtain evidence by force.

UNESCO_Site: Kyiv: Saint-Sophia Cathedral and Related Monastic Buildings Kyiv-Pechersk Lavra
ACLED_Notes: On 30 November 2018, unidentified individuals followed to the house and tried to stab a Donbass veteran and members of Traditions and Order in Kyiv. The attackers cut the veteran's face and clothes with a knife and escaped.

UNESCO_Site: Kyiv: Saint-Sophia Cathedral and Related Monastic Buildings Kyiv-Pechersk Lavra
ACLED_Notes: As reported on Dec. 13 2018, in Kiev, the Security Service of Ukraine uncovered an organised group, which was illegally preparing, re-equipping and selling weapons, and seized 20 illegal firearms and 2500 rounds of various types of ammunition. Participants of the group included active members of the Podilskyy district directorate of the National Police in Kiev.

UNESCO_Site: Kyiv: Saint-Sophia Cathedral and Related Monastic Buildings Kyiv-Pechersk Lavra
ACLED_Notes: As reported on Dec. 14 2018, the Security Service of Ukraine confiscated 21 F-1 hand grenades, 3 RGD-5 grenades, 15 grenades for a VOG underbarrel grenade launcher and over 3 kg of TNT from a man near Kiev, Ukraine.

UNESCO_Site: Kyiv: Saint-Sophia Cathedral and Related Monastic Buildings Kyiv-Pechersk Lavra
ACLED_Notes: On 22 February 2019, unidentified persons burned down a car of a journalist in Kiev, Ukraine. No injuries or fatalities were reported. The journalist blames a military prosecutor who previously threatened him with beating or burning his car for writing posts about the prosecutor and his family.

UNESCO_Site: Kyiv: Saint-Sophia Cathedral and Related Monastic Buildings Kyiv-Pechersk Lavra
ACLED_Notes: As reported on 6 March, the police seized six pistols, four carbines, a sniper rifle, seven RGD-5 grenades, an anti-personnel mine, 642 grams of plastic explosive and 448 rounds of ammunition from a group of people in Kiev, Ukraine.

UNESCO_Site: Kyiv: Saint-Sophia Cathedral and Related Monastic Buildings Kyiv-Pechersk Lavra
ACLED_Notes: On 4 May 2019, a son of a former deputy mayor of Horlivka and now a member of the DPR government was shot dead in his apartment in Kiev.

UNESCO_Site: Kyiv: Saint-Sophia Cathedral and Related Monastic Buildings Kyiv-Pechersk Lavra
ACLED_Notes: On 7 September 2019, Ukraine and Russia exchanged 35 prisoners from each side. Among the prisoners released by Russia are Ukrainian filmmaker Sentsov and 24 Ukrainian sailors whose imprisonment sparked numerous demonstrations in Ukraine. Among those handed over to Moscow are Ukrainian and Russian citizens involved in the conflict in Eastern Ukraine including a witness in MH17 commercial flight downing case.

UNESCO_Site: Kyiv: Saint-Sophia Cathedral and Related Monastic Buildings Kyiv-Pechersk Lavra
ACLED_Notes: On 1 October 2019, the Trilateral Contact Group on Ukraine agreed on the so-called 'Steinmeier formula' during the negotiations in Minsk that foresees that a law on the special status of Donbass comes into force from the day the non-government-controlled Luhansk and Donetsk hold democratic elections in accordance with the Ukrainian law and OSCE standards. The parties also agreed to start the disengagement of forces in Zolote and Petrovskoye areas on 7 October [coded to Kiev, Ukraine].

UNESCO_Site: Kyiv: Saint-Sophia Cathedral and Related Monastic Buildings Kyiv-Pechersk Lavra
ACLED_Notes: On 24 October 2019, three people beat up a Stop Corruption activist in Kiev.

UNESCO_Site: Kyiv: Saint-Sophia Cathedral and Related Monastic Buildings Kyiv-Pechersk Lavra
ACLED_Notes: On 8 November 2019, a group of people in military uniform broke into an attorney's house in Kyiv Region, beat and tied down him and his family, including his child, and stole his case files.

UNESCO_Site: Kyiv: Saint-Sophia Cathedral and Related Monastic Buildings Kyiv-Pechersk Lavra
ACLED_Notes: On 12 March 2020, unidentified individuals set fire to a car of the acting head of State Environmental Inspectorate near his apartment in Kyiv. The car was destroyed, no injuries were reported. The victim connects the arson to his activities as the state official, in particular his high fines for polluters and anti-corruption measures.

UNESCO_Site: Kyiv: Saint-Sophia Cathedral and Related Monastic Buildings Kyiv-Pechersk Lavra
ACLED_Notes: Security measures: On 17 March 2020, the government of Ukraine in Kiev enacted measures to limit the spread of coronavirus - including a ban on gatherings exceeding 10 people and shutting down stores and other public places except those that sell food or medicine. On 22 May 2020, the government of Ukraine eased the quarantine restrictions.

UNESCO_Site: Kyiv: Saint-Sophia Cathedral and Related Monastic Buildings Kyiv-Pechersk Lavra
ACLED_Notes: On 14 April 2020, in Kyiv, the Security Service of Ukraine (SBU) counterintelligence arrested an SBU major general Shaitanov on charges of high treason: spying for the Russian FSB and arranging attacks on Ukrainian volunteers as part of the FSB's reconnaissance and sabotage operations inside Ukraine.

UNESCO_Site: Kyiv: Saint-Sophia Cathedral and Related Monastic Buildings Kyiv-Pechersk Lavra
ACLED_Notes: On 7 May 2020, according to the victims, two Donbas veterans from the Azov Battalion were severely beaten by members of National Corps in Kyiv for their support of Serhiy Sternenko - a former member of Right Sector who stabbed in self-defence one of his attackers during the third attack on his life. The leader of National Corps denies these accusations, although confirms the meeting with the two veterans.

UNESCO_Site: Kyiv: Saint-Sophia Cathedral and Related Monastic Buildings Kyiv-Pechersk Lavra
ACLED_Notes: Property destruction: On 28 August 2020, unidentified individuals set fire to a car of a member of Parliament from the Servant of the People party in Kiev. No injuries were reported.

UNESCO_Site: Kyiv: Saint-Sophia Cathedral and Related Monastic Buildings Kyiv-Pechersk Lavra
ACLED_Notes: On 16 October 2020, unidentified individuals severely beat in Kiev a Ukrainian activist and Donbas veteran who was imprisoned by DPR for almost 3 years.

UNESCO_Site: Kyiv: Saint-Sophia Cathedral and Related Monastic Buildings Kyiv-Pechersk Lavra
ACLED_Notes: On 30 October 2020, an unidentified individual attacked with a knife or a piece of glass a journalist near his house in Kiev and cut his face.

UNESCO_Site: Kyiv: Saint-Sophia Cathedral and Related Monastic Buildings Kyiv-Pechersk Lavra
ACLED_Notes: Security measures: On 9 December 2020, the government of Ukraine in Kiev enacted measures to limit the spread of coronavirus - including shutting down stores and other public places except those that sell food or medicine.

UNESCO_Site: Kyiv: Saint-Sophia Cathedral and Related Monastic Buildings Kyiv-Pechersk Lavra
ACLED_Notes: On 24 March 2021, unidentified persons abducted and killed in Kiev a veteran of the war in eastern Ukraine. The alleged reason could be that he was systematically combating raiders who were illegally occupying other people's flats in Kiev. Police started a criminal case.

UNESCO_Site: Kyiv: Saint-Sophia Cathedral and Related Monastic Buildings Kyiv-Pechersk Lavra
ACLED_Notes: Property destruction: On 18 April 2021, unknown individuals damaged the doors of the reception office of the Democratic Axe Party in Kiev and poured paint on them. The members of the Democratic Axe suspect that the provocation was organised by the president's adviser in response to criticism by party members of his activities.

UNESCO_Site: Kyiv: Saint-Sophia Cathedral and Related Monastic Buildings Kyiv-Pechersk Lavra
ACLED_Notes: On 18 May 2021, a police officer severely beat underage youths while detaining them in Kiev.

UNESCO_Site: Kyiv: Saint-Sophia Cathedral and Related Monastic Buildings Kyiv-Pechersk Lavra
ACLED_Notes: On 19 May 2021, police severely beat and detained an artist in Kiev. According to the victim, he had his nose smashed for no reason and was kept outside for several hours.

UNESCO_Site: Kyiv: Saint-Sophia Cathedral and Related Monastic Buildings Kyiv-Pechersk Lavra
ACLED_Notes: On 4 June 2021, unidentified individuals attacked the deputy chairman of the National Agency for Identifying, Tracing and Managing Assets Obtained through Corruption and Other Crimes in Kiev, when he was off duty. The victim sustained a gunshot wound.

UNESCO_Site: Kyiv: Saint-Sophia Cathedral and Related Monastic Buildings Kyiv-Pechersk Lavra
ACLED_Notes: Weapons seizure: On 18 June 2021, the Security Service of Ukraine seized a cache of weapons on the territory of the municipal enterprise Municipal Guard in Kiev, consisting of RPG-22 grenade launcher; 400 g of TNT, 2 cases of RGD-5 grenades, a U.S.-made KRISS semi-automatic pistol of 9*21 mm caliber, almost a hundred rounds of various calibers, a significant amount of hunting rifled weapons.

UNESCO_Site: Kyiv: Saint-Sophia Cathedral and Related Monastic Buildings Kyiv-Pechersk Lavra
ACLED_Notes: Property destruction: On 22 June 2021, unidentified individuals set fire to an activist's car in Kiev. The victim connects the arson to his activities against the illegal construction on the site of a park.

UNESCO_Site: Kyiv: Saint-Sophia Cathedral and Related Monastic Buildings Kyiv-Pechersk Lavra
ACLED_Notes: On 30 June 2021, unidentified individuals, allegedly far-right activists attacked and beat in Kiev a former Kharkiv separatist, who has several times avoided attending the trial for kidnapping during the Revolution of Dignity.

UNESCO_Site: Kyiv: Saint-Sophia Cathedral and Related Monastic Buildings Kyiv-Pechersk Lavra
ACLED_Notes: On 24 August 2021, an unidentified individual poured brilliant green [chemical desinfectant, Zelyonka] on former Ukrainian President Petro Poroshenko in Kiev. The victim was hospitalized with burns to his eyes.

UNESCO_Site: Kyiv: Saint-Sophia Cathedral and Related Monastic Buildings Kyiv-Pechersk Lavra
ACLED_Notes: Property destruction: On 26 August 2021, a man threw a Molotov cocktail at the entrance of the ombudsman's office in Kiev, as a result of which the doors of the premises were damaged. None of the workers and visitors was injured. Ombudsman believed that an NGO that opposes her work and position on equal rights of all citizens of Ukraine could be behind this incident. The attacker was detained.

UNESCO_Site: Kyiv: Saint-Sophia Cathedral and Related Monastic Buildings Kyiv-Pechersk Lavra
ACLED_Notes: On 30 September 2021, an unknown individual fired at the vehicle of a Head of the State Archive Service in Kiev who was not in the car at the moment of the attack. His driver was wounded in the incident and hospitalized.

UNESCO_Site: Kyiv: Saint-Sophia Cathedral and Related Monastic Buildings Kyiv-Pechersk Lavra
ACLED_Notes: Property destruction: On 22 October 2021, an unidentified individual tried to set fire to the house of the deputy head of the Office of the President in charge of European integration in Kiev with a Molotov cocktail.

UNESCO_Site: Kyiv: Saint-Sophia Cathedral and Related Monastic Buildings Kyiv-Pechersk Lavra
ACLED_Notes: On 6 January 2022, officers of Ukrainian Special Forces broke into an apartment and beat activists of Democratic Choice of Kazakhstan in Kiev, accusing them of coordinating the protests in Kazakhstan.

ACLED_Notes: On 20 November 2024, Russian forces conducted a drone strike in Kyiv region, resulting in damage to a kindergarten, a school, three administrative buildings, two shops and agricultural machinery (coded to Kyiv, Kyiv). There were no casualties.

UNESCO_Site: Kyiv: Saint-Sophia Cathedral and Related Monastic Buildings Kyiv-Pechersk Lavra
ACLED_Notes: Interception: On 22 November 2024, Ukrainian military forces intercepted 64 Russian kamikaze-drones, some likely over the Kyiv region (coded to Kyiv, Kyiv City).

UNESCO_Site: Kyiv: Saint-Sophia Cathedral and Related Monastic Buildings Kyiv-Pechersk Lavra
ACLED_Notes: On 24 November 2024, at night, Russian military forces carried out massive 'Shahed' drone strikes at unspecified targets in the Kyiv region. According to local sources, the drone debris damaged an industrial enterprise in the Kyiv region. Casualties unknown. Also, at night, Ukrainian air defense forces shot down in total 50 attack drones over the multiple locations, some over the Kyiv region (coded to Kyiv city, Kyiv region). Also, 19 Russian drones were lost likely due to Ukrainian EW systems. 4 more Russian attack drones were still on combat operations in the airspace.

UNESCO_Site: Kyiv: Saint-Sophia Cathedral and Related Monastic Buildings Kyiv-Pechersk Lavra
ACLED_Notes: On 25 November 2024, Ukrainian Forces intercepted Russian drones over Kyiv region. The debris of the downed drones damaged a private property, several cars and 4 houses. No casualties.

UNESCO_Site: Kyiv: Saint-Sophia Cathedral and Related Monastic Buildings Kyiv-Pechersk Lavra
ACLED_Notes: On 26 November 2024, Russian Forces launched a record number of drones against Ukraine - 188 Shahed and other unspecified drones (suspectedly decoy drones). Ukrainian Forces intercepted 76 drones, some of them over Kyiv region (coded to Kyiv, Kyiv). 95 more Russian drones were lost in Ukrainian airspace suspectedly due to Ukrainian electronic warfare (EW) interference. the fallen debris of the downed drones damaged 4 houses, 2 apartment buildings, an outbuilding, 2 garages and a car in Kyiv region. No casualties.

UNESCO_Site: Kyiv: Saint-Sophia Cathedral and Related Monastic Buildings Kyiv-Pechersk Lavra
ACLED_Notes: Interception: On 28 November 2024, Ukrainian forces shot down Russian Kh-101 missiles and Shahed drones above Kyiv, Kyiv City.

UNESCO_Site: Kyiv: Saint-Sophia Cathedral and Related Monastic Buildings Kyiv-Pechersk Lavra
ACLED_Notes: On 29 November 2024, Ukrainian military forces intercepted 88 Russian kamikaze-drones across several locations, some over the Kyiv region (coded to Kyiv, Kyiv City). The drones' debris damaged a residential property and outbuilding. There were no casualties.

UNESCO_Site: Kyiv: Saint-Sophia Cathedral and Related Monastic Buildings Kyiv-Pechersk Lavra
ACLED_Notes: Interception: On 1 December 2024, Ukrainian forces shot down Russian drones over Kyiv region (coded to Kyiv).

UNESCO_Site: Kyiv: Saint-Sophia Cathedral and Related Monastic Buildings Kyiv-Pechersk Lavra
ACLED_Notes: Interception: On 2 December 2024, Russian Forces launched 110 Shahed drones and other unidentified drone types at targets in Ukraine. Ukrainian Forces intercepted 52 drones, some of them over Kyiv region (coded to Kyiv, Kyiv). 50 more Russian drones were lost in Ukrainian airspace suspectedly due to Ukrainian electronic warfare (EW) interference. No casualties.

UNESCO_Site: Kyiv: Saint-Sophia Cathedral and Related Monastic Buildings Kyiv-Pechersk Lavra
ACLED_Notes: On 3 December 2024, Ukrainian Forces intercepted 22 Russian drones, some of them over Kyiv region (coded to Kyiv, Kyiv). The fallen debris of the downed drones damaged 4 houses, gas pipelines and 2 cars. No casualties.

UNESCO_Site: Kyiv: Saint-Sophia Cathedral and Related Monastic Buildings Kyiv-Pechersk Lavra
ACLED_Notes: Interception: On 3 December 2024, Ukrainian Forces intercepted 22 Russian drones, some of them over the Kyiv region (coded to Kyiv city). No casualties.

UNESCO_Site: Kyiv: Saint-Sophia Cathedral and Related Monastic Buildings Kyiv-Pechersk Lavra
ACLED_Notes: Around 4 December 2024 (as reported), Russian authorities returned the body of a Ukrainian mayor captured by the Russian forces in the Zaporizhzhia region at the start of the full-scale invasion to Ukraine (coded to Kyiv). The man died in Russian captivity under mysterious circumstances. According to Ukrainian officials, he might have been tortured to death.

UNESCO_Site: Kyiv: Saint-Sophia Cathedral and Related Monastic Buildings Kyiv-Pechersk Lavra
ACLED_Notes: Property destruction: Around 4 December 2024 (as reported), according to the SBU, prosecutors, and the police, a previously-convicted 33-year-old set fire to a relay cabinet near a railway station in the city of Kyiv, following promises of money from Russians.

UNESCO_Site: Kyiv: Saint-Sophia Cathedral and Related Monastic Buildings Kyiv-Pechersk Lavra
ACLED_Notes: Interception: On 5 December 2024, Ukrainian forces engaged Russian Shahed drones above Kyiv Oblast (coded as Kyiv, Kyiv City.) More than 12 Russian drones were shot down near or around Kyiv. 30 Russian drones were intercepted above Kharkiv, Poltava, Sumy, Chernihiv, Cherkasy, Kirovhrad, Zhytomyr, Kyiiv, Vinnytsia, and Khmelnytsky Oblasts. 12 drones disappeared and 1 disappeared near or in Belarus.

UNESCO_Site: Kyiv: Saint-Sophia Cathedral and Related Monastic Buildings Kyiv-Pechersk Lavra
ACLED_Notes: Property destruction: On 5 December 2024, a 26-year-old previously convicted man set fire to police vehicles in the city of Kyiv in revenge for police arresting him for curfew violation.

UNESCO_Site: Kyiv: Saint-Sophia Cathedral and Related Monastic Buildings Kyiv-Pechersk Lavra
ACLED_Notes: On 6 December 2024, Russian drones attacked Kyiv, Kyiv City. The Ukrainian military intercepted 32 drones across multiple locations, some over the Kyiv region. Drones' debris damaged residential property, a garage and outbuildings. There were no casualties.

UNESCO_Site: Kyiv: Saint-Sophia Cathedral and Related Monastic Buildings Kyiv-Pechersk Lavra
ACLED_Notes: On 7 December 2024, Russian forces launched a Shahed drone strike at Kyiv region (coded to Kyiv, Kyiv region). While Ukrainian air defence forces intercepted drones, several houses and vehicles were damaged by the falling debris. No casualties.

UNESCO_Site: Kyiv: Saint-Sophia Cathedral and Related Monastic Buildings Kyiv-Pechersk Lavra
ACLED_Notes: Interception: On 8 December 2024, Ukrainian forces shot down Russian drones over Kyiv region (coded to Kyiv).

UNESCO_Site: Kyiv: Saint-Sophia Cathedral and Related Monastic Buildings Kyiv-Pechersk Lavra
ACLED_Notes: Property destruction: Around 10 December 2024, according to the SBU, two men, aged 17 and 20, set fire to a military pickup undergoing repair in the city of Kyiv, following Russian commands. The men were quickly arrested.

UNESCO_Site: Kyiv: Saint-Sophia Cathedral and Related Monastic Buildings Kyiv-Pechersk Lavra
ACLED_Notes: Interception: On 12 December 2024, Ukrainian forces engaged Russian drones above Kyiv Oblast (coded to Kyiv, Kyiv City.)

UNESCO_Site: Kyiv: Saint-Sophia Cathedral and Related Monastic Buildings Kyiv-Pechersk Lavra
ACLED_Notes: On 13 December 2024, Ukrainian military forces intercepted Russian drones and missiles over Kyiv region (coded to Kyiv, Kyiv City). The debris damaged residential buildings. There were no casualties.

UNESCO_Site: Kyiv: Saint-Sophia Cathedral and Related Monastic Buildings Kyiv-Pechersk Lavra
ACLED_Notes: On 14 December 2024, Russian forces launched a drone strike at Kyiv region (coded to Kyiv, Kyiv region). Ukrainian air defence forces intercepted about 10 drones, but the falling debris in the Darnytskyi district damaged an enterprise and warehouses, causing a fire. Casualties unknown.

UNESCO_Site: Kyiv: Saint-Sophia Cathedral and Related Monastic Buildings Kyiv-Pechersk Lavra
ACLED_Notes: Interception: On 15 December 2024, Ukrainian forces shot down Russian drones over Kyiv region (coded to Kyiv).

UNESCO_Site: Kyiv: Saint-Sophia Cathedral and Related Monastic Buildings Kyiv-Pechersk Lavra
ACLED_Notes: Weapons seizure: Around 15 December 2024 (month of), according to the Security Service of Ukraine, the SBU arrested a 16-year-old man who was planting an explosive device outside a military unit in the Kyiv region (coded to Kyiv). The explosive device was prepared by two women recruited by Russian services and who handed the explosive to the man.

UNESCO_Site: Kyiv: Saint-Sophia Cathedral and Related Monastic Buildings Kyiv-Pechersk Lavra
ACLED_Notes: Defusal: Around 15 December 2024 (month of), the Security Service prevented the explosion of an explosive device planted by a 16-year-old man near a military unit in the Kyiv region (coded to Kyiv). The man was following Russian commands and likely involved a 19-year-old man and 2 other women preparing the explosives.

UNESCO_Site: Kyiv: Saint-Sophia Cathedral and Related Monastic Buildings Kyiv-Pechersk Lavra
ACLED_Notes: On 19 December 2024, debris from Russian drones crashed into a private home and onto train tracks on Kyiv, Kyiv City. The home was damaged. No casualties.

UNESCO_Site: Kyiv: Saint-Sophia Cathedral and Related Monastic Buildings Kyiv-Pechersk Lavra
ACLED_Notes: Interception: On 19 December 2024, Ukrainian forces engaged Russian drones and missiles above Kyiv Oblast (coded as Kyiv, Kyiv City.) 45 Shahed drones and drones of other types were shot down above Poltava, Sumy, Kharkiv, Kyiv, Khmelnytskyi, Chernihiv, Cherkasy, Kirovohrad, Dnipropetrovsk, and Mykolaiv. 40 other drones were interdicted with electronic warfare systems and lost.

UNESCO_Site: Kyiv: Saint-Sophia Cathedral and Related Monastic Buildings Kyiv-Pechersk Lavra
ACLED_Notes: On 20 December 2024, Russian Kindzhal and Iskander missiles attacked Kyiv, Kyiv City. 1 civilians was killed, 13 wounded (1 killed and 2 wounded coded to the specific event in Kyiv - Holosiivskyi).

UNESCO_Site: Kyiv: Saint-Sophia Cathedral and Related Monastic Buildings Kyiv-Pechersk Lavra
ACLED_Notes: Interception: On 20 December 2024, Ukrainian military forces intercepted 40 Russian kamikaze-drones over multiple locations, some over the Kyiv region (coded to Kyiv, Kyiv City).

UNESCO_Site: Kyiv: Saint-Sophia Cathedral and Related Monastic Buildings Kyiv-Pechersk Lavra
ACLED_Notes: Property destruction: On 11 January 2018, unidentified individuals set fire to a car in Kiev belonging to the head of an initiative group for public control over the investigation into the murder of human rights activist Iryna Nozdrovska. The fire spread to another car parked nearby. No injuries were reported.

UNESCO_Site: Kyiv: Saint-Sophia Cathedral and Related Monastic Buildings Kyiv-Pechersk Lavra
ACLED_Notes: Other: On 18 January 2018, Ukraine's parliament in Kiev has passed a bill on de-occupation of Donbas region. The supporters of the bill, including President Poroshenko, say it will help Kyiv restore control over areas in the east that are held by Russia-backed separatists. The bill defines Donetsk and Luhansk regions as 'temporarily occupied territories', contrary to the autonomy granted to them in the Minsk agreement, and labels Russia as 'aggressor'.

UNESCO_Site: Kyiv: Saint-Sophia Cathedral and Related Monastic Buildings Kyiv-Pechersk Lavra
ACLED_Notes: On 25 January 2018, Ukraine presented the first cyber security centre in Kiev, strengthening its capacity to combat cyber crime. The centre was opened thanks to cooperation with Nato and the SBU.

UNESCO_Site: Kyiv: Saint-Sophia Cathedral and Related Monastic Buildings Kyiv-Pechersk Lavra
ACLED_Notes: On 26 January 2018, in Kyiv, an additional 50 Canadian servicemen have arrived in Ukraine to train the country's troops as part of the UNIFIER mission, Lt. Col. Kristopher Reeves, commander of the Canadian army's Joint Task Force-Ukraine stated.

UNESCO_Site: Kyiv: Saint-Sophia Cathedral and Related Monastic Buildings Kyiv-Pechersk Lavra
ACLED_Notes: On 7 February 2018, in Kiev, members of the National Corps attacked two men who were planning to distribute 'antifascist' leaflets. The victims claimed to be members of the Communist Party from western Ukraine.

UNESCO_Site: Kyiv: Saint-Sophia Cathedral and Related Monastic Buildings Kyiv-Pechersk Lavra
ACLED_Notes: On 8 February 2018, a journalist was injured after gas was dispersed in the Vesti office as the National Agency for Identifying, Tracing and Managing Assets Obtained through Corruption and Other Crimes took control of the editorial offices of the Vesti newspaper in Kiev. This was done under criminal proceedings against the former minister for taxes and levies, who is accused of corruption.

UNESCO_Site: Kyiv: Saint-Sophia Cathedral and Related Monastic Buildings Kyiv-Pechersk Lavra
ACLED_Notes: On 12 February 2018, State Border Guards detained Mikheil Saakashvili, the leader of the New Forces Movement Party in Ukraine and ex-president of Georgia while he was dining in a restaurant in Kiev. Saakashvili faces extradition.

UNESCO_Site: Kyiv: Saint-Sophia Cathedral and Related Monastic Buildings Kyiv-Pechersk Lavra
ACLED_Notes: On 16 February 2018, 2018 Police Forces of Ukraine seized over 100 improvised explosive devices, bottles with an unidentified flammable substance, and a large amount of marijuana during the searches at the home of one Kiev resident.

UNESCO_Site: Kyiv: Saint-Sophia Cathedral and Related Monastic Buildings Kyiv-Pechersk Lavra
ACLED_Notes: On 21 March 2018, an Azerbaijani journalist was attacked at his residence in Kiev by unknown persons, which resulted in several injuries.

UNESCO_Site: Kyiv: Saint-Sophia Cathedral and Related Monastic Buildings Kyiv-Pechersk Lavra
ACLED_Notes: Other: On 30 March 2018, Ukraine has expelled 13 Russian diplomats from the territory of the country in connection with a nerve gas attack against former double agent Sergei Skripal and his daughter Yulia in Salisbury on March 4 [coded to Kiev].

UNESCO_Site: Kyiv: Saint-Sophia Cathedral and Related Monastic Buildings Kyiv-Pechersk Lavra
ACLED_Notes: Weapons seizure: Around 20 April 2018, the Security Service of Ukraine exposed an organized group in Kiev that established the illegal export of weapons and ammunition from the ATO area. During the investigation it was established that former members of one of the volunteer battalions sent weapons and parts of ammunition for assembling and manufacturing in one of the workshops in Kiev to be used for further re-sale in the capital region and to members of criminal circles throughout Ukraine. The SBU seized four anti-tank grenade launchers, 30 grenades, two large-calibre projectiles, three kilograms of plastid, three detonators, six rifles, three automatic weapons, 37 pistols and traumatic guns and almost 15,000 ammunition rounds.

UNESCO_Site: Kyiv: Saint-Sophia Cathedral and Related Monastic Buildings Kyiv-Pechersk Lavra
ACLED_Notes: Weapons seizure: Around 20 April 2018 (as reported), the Security Service of Ukraine stopped the activities of an international group that supplied weapons to Ukraine from Europe and the United States. During the investigation it was established that a resident of Kiev had established a channel for the supply of spare parts for pistols and automatic devices which were brought into Ukraine by couriers and later assembled in workshops for use in combat. The SBU seized three machine guns, three assault rifles, two rifles, seven submachine guns, 30 pistols and revolvers, eight grenade launchers, 32 grenades, five mines, 3,240 ammunition rounds and assembly kits pistols.

UNESCO_Site: Kyiv: Saint-Sophia Cathedral and Related Monastic Buildings Kyiv-Pechersk Lavra
ACLED_Notes: Weapons seizure: On 1 May 2018, Ukrainian law enforcers have discovered a package with arms and ammunition on Trukhaniv Island in Kiev which contained four grenades, detonators, five TNT blocks, 10 projectiles for a grenade launcher, five cartridges for a rifle and about 1,500 rounds of ammunition.

UNESCO_Site: Kyiv: Saint-Sophia Cathedral and Related Monastic Buildings Kyiv-Pechersk Lavra
ACLED_Notes: Security measures: On 8 May 2018, the Security Service of Ukraine carried out searches at home of the Ukrainian Communist Party leader Petro Symonenko in Kiev and recovered campaign leaflets calling for constitutional change or government overthrow or takeover, and seized items looking like a Stechkin pistol with a silencer and 120 cartridges. Symonenko had been summoned for questioning as part of a criminal inquiry into 'actions aimed at violent change or overthrow of the constitutional system or seizure of government power' and 'high treason,' according to the SBU spokeswoman Olena Hytlyanska. Later in the day SBU officers raided the homes of senior Communists in and around Kyiv and recovered campaign materials containing banned Communist symbols.

UNESCO_Site: Kyiv: Saint-Sophia Cathedral and Related Monastic Buildings Kyiv-Pechersk Lavra
ACLED_Notes: On 17 May 2018, unidentified individuals attacked a Donbas veteran in Kiev who had become famous for his travel blog, in particular, after he published a video of arguing with and spitting in the face of a pro-Kremlin Russian journalist. The victim sustained injuries to his head.

UNESCO_Site: Kyiv: Saint-Sophia Cathedral and Related Monastic Buildings Kyiv-Pechersk Lavra
ACLED_Notes: On 30 May 2018, in Kiev, Ukrainian authorities detained a Ukrainian citizen, Borys Herman, accused of being recruited by Russia's secret services to organize a murder plot against self-exiled Russian reporter and Kremlin critic Arkady Babchenko. Ukraine's Security Service (SBU) says it thwarted the planned killing by working together with Babchenko to fake his death. Ukrainian authorities also said a total of up to 30 people in Ukraine had been targeted for killing as part of the alleged Russian plot. Both SBU officials and Babchenko have defended their decision to fake Babchenko's death - rejecting criticism from reporters and journalism advocates who warned that it has undermined the credibility of law enforcement agencies and independent media organizations.

UNESCO_Site: Kyiv: Saint-Sophia Cathedral and Related Monastic Buildings Kyiv-Pechersk Lavra
ACLED_Notes: Around 21 June 2018 (between 18 June - 24 June), more than 20 LGBT activists and volunteers of the March of Equality were assaulted and beaten in Kiev.

UNESCO_Site: Kyiv: Saint-Sophia Cathedral and Related Monastic Buildings Kyiv-Pechersk Lavra
ACLED_Notes: Property destruction: On 6 August 2018, unidentified individuals tried to break into the house of a TV journalist and her parents outside Kiev by breaking the door, however fled when neighbours called the police. One of the attackers was identified as a member of a Chechen criminal group and was placed on the wanted list.

UNESCO_Site: Kyiv: Saint-Sophia Cathedral and Related Monastic Buildings Kyiv-Pechersk Lavra
ACLED_Notes: Weapons seizure: On 15 August 2018, in Kiev, law enforcers uncovered an arms cache in a garage cooperative, belonging to a former Kiev-2 battalion serviceman, with a large quantity of firearms, ammunition and explosives.

UNESCO_Site: Kyiv: Saint-Sophia Cathedral and Related Monastic Buildings Kyiv-Pechersk Lavra
ACLED_Notes: On 6 September 2018, The head of the National Police, Serhiy Knyazyev, has said that Russia arms rebels in east Ukraine with weapons seized during the annexation of Crimea. Over these four years, police have registered 60 cases of seizing Crimean weapons from rebels, including 51 assault rifles, 15 pistols, two grenade launchers and one carbine. Police have opened a criminal case against the Russian Federation according to Part 2, Article 438 of the Criminal Code on using internationally illegal warfare methods.

UNESCO_Site: Kyiv: Saint-Sophia Cathedral and Related Monastic Buildings Kyiv-Pechersk Lavra
ACLED_Notes: On 26 October 2018, unidentified individuals attacked a member of Radical Party near his house in Kiev. They broke his nose and jaw and caused him a concussion. The party connects the attack to the victim's protest activity.

UNESCO_Site: Kyiv: Saint-Sophia Cathedral and Related Monastic Buildings Kyiv-Pechersk Lavra
ACLED_Notes: As reported on Nov. 28 2018, in Kiev, the Security Service of Ukraine uncovered an organised group, which was assembling and illegally selling weapons, and seized 8 illegal firearms. Members of the group included a National Guard serviceman who was arrested.

UNESCO_Site: Kyiv: Saint-Sophia Cathedral and Related Monastic Buildings Kyiv-Pechersk Lavra
ACLED_Notes: On Nov. 29 2018, after the arrest of the Ukrainian blogger Oleksandr Baraboshko in Kiev, Ukraine, members of the military prosecutor's office inflicted light bodily injuries on him and tried to obtain evidence by force.

UNESCO_Site: Kyiv: Saint-Sophia Cathedral and Related Monastic Buildings Kyiv-Pechersk Lavra
ACLED_Notes: On 30 November 2018, unidentified individuals followed to the house and tried to stab a Donbass veteran and members of Traditions and Order in Kyiv. The attackers cut the veteran's face and clothes with a knife and escaped.

UNESCO_Site: Kyiv: Saint-Sophia Cathedral and Related Monastic Buildings Kyiv-Pechersk Lavra
ACLED_Notes: As reported on Dec. 13 2018, in Kiev, the Security Service of Ukraine uncovered an organised group, which was illegally preparing, re-equipping and selling weapons, and seized 20 illegal firearms and 2500 rounds of various types of ammunition. Participants of the group included active members of the Podilskyy district directorate of the National Police in Kiev.

UNESCO_Site: Kyiv: Saint-Sophia Cathedral and Related Monastic Buildings Kyiv-Pechersk Lavra
ACLED_Notes: As reported on Dec. 14 2018, the Security Service of Ukraine confiscated 21 F-1 hand grenades, 3 RGD-5 grenades, 15 grenades for a VOG underbarrel grenade launcher and over 3 kg of TNT from a man near Kiev, Ukraine.

UNESCO_Site: Kyiv: Saint-Sophia Cathedral and Related Monastic Buildings Kyiv-Pechersk Lavra
ACLED_Notes: On 22 February 2019, unidentified persons burned down a car of a journalist in Kiev, Ukraine. No injuries or fatalities were reported. The journalist blames a military prosecutor who previously threatened him with beating or burning his car for writing posts about the prosecutor and his family.

UNESCO_Site: Kyiv: Saint-Sophia Cathedral and Related Monastic Buildings Kyiv-Pechersk Lavra
ACLED_Notes: As reported on 6 March, the police seized six pistols, four carbines, a sniper rifle, seven RGD-5 grenades, an anti-personnel mine, 642 grams of plastic explosive and 448 rounds of ammunition from a group of people in Kiev, Ukraine.

UNESCO_Site: Kyiv: Saint-Sophia Cathedral and Related Monastic Buildings Kyiv-Pechersk Lavra
ACLED_Notes: On 4 May 2019, a son of a former deputy mayor of Horlivka and now a member of the DPR government was shot dead in his apartment in Kiev.

UNESCO_Site: Kyiv: Saint-Sophia Cathedral and Related Monastic Buildings Kyiv-Pechersk Lavra
ACLED_Notes: On 7 September 2019, Ukraine and Russia exchanged 35 prisoners from each side. Among the prisoners released by Russia are Ukrainian filmmaker Sentsov and 24 Ukrainian sailors whose imprisonment sparked numerous demonstrations in Ukraine. Among those handed over to Moscow are Ukrainian and Russian citizens involved in the conflict in Eastern Ukraine including a witness in MH17 commercial flight downing case.

UNESCO_Site: Kyiv: Saint-Sophia Cathedral and Related Monastic Buildings Kyiv-Pechersk Lavra
ACLED_Notes: On 1 October 2019, the Trilateral Contact Group on Ukraine agreed on the so-called 'Steinmeier formula' during the negotiations in Minsk that foresees that a law on the special status of Donbass comes into force from the day the non-government-controlled Luhansk and Donetsk hold democratic elections in accordance with the Ukrainian law and OSCE standards. The parties also agreed to start the disengagement of forces in Zolote and Petrovskoye areas on 7 October [coded to Kiev, Ukraine].

UNESCO_Site: Kyiv: Saint-Sophia Cathedral and Related Monastic Buildings Kyiv-Pechersk Lavra
ACLED_Notes: On 24 October 2019, three people beat up a Stop Corruption activist in Kiev.

UNESCO_Site: Kyiv: Saint-Sophia Cathedral and Related Monastic Buildings Kyiv-Pechersk Lavra
ACLED_Notes: On 8 November 2019, a group of people in military uniform broke into an attorney's house in Kyiv Region, beat and tied down him and his family, including his child, and stole his case files.

UNESCO_Site: Kyiv: Saint-Sophia Cathedral and Related Monastic Buildings Kyiv-Pechersk Lavra
ACLED_Notes: On 12 March 2020, unidentified individuals set fire to a car of the acting head of State Environmental Inspectorate near his apartment in Kyiv. The car was destroyed, no injuries were reported. The victim connects the arson to his activities as the state official, in particular his high fines for polluters and anti-corruption measures.

UNESCO_Site: Kyiv: Saint-Sophia Cathedral and Related Monastic Buildings Kyiv-Pechersk Lavra
ACLED_Notes: Security measures: On 17 March 2020, the government of Ukraine in Kiev enacted measures to limit the spread of coronavirus - including a ban on gatherings exceeding 10 people and shutting down stores and other public places except those that sell food or medicine. On 22 May 2020, the government of Ukraine eased the quarantine restrictions.

UNESCO_Site: Kyiv: Saint-Sophia Cathedral and Related Monastic Buildings Kyiv-Pechersk Lavra
ACLED_Notes: On 14 April 2020, in Kyiv, the Security Service of Ukraine (SBU) counterintelligence arrested an SBU major general Shaitanov on charges of high treason: spying for the Russian FSB and arranging attacks on Ukrainian volunteers as part of the FSB's reconnaissance and sabotage operations inside Ukraine.

UNESCO_Site: Kyiv: Saint-Sophia Cathedral and Related Monastic Buildings Kyiv-Pechersk Lavra
ACLED_Notes: On 7 May 2020, according to the victims, two Donbas veterans from the Azov Battalion were severely beaten by members of National Corps in Kyiv for their support of Serhiy Sternenko - a former member of Right Sector who stabbed in self-defence one of his attackers during the third attack on his life. The leader of National Corps denies these accusations, although confirms the meeting with the two veterans.

UNESCO_Site: Kyiv: Saint-Sophia Cathedral and Related Monastic Buildings Kyiv-Pechersk Lavra
ACLED_Notes: Property destruction: On 28 August 2020, unidentified individuals set fire to a car of a member of Parliament from the Servant of the People party in Kiev. No injuries were reported.

UNESCO_Site: Kyiv: Saint-Sophia Cathedral and Related Monastic Buildings Kyiv-Pechersk Lavra
ACLED_Notes: On 16 October 2020, unidentified individuals severely beat in Kiev a Ukrainian activist and Donbas veteran who was imprisoned by DPR for almost 3 years.

UNESCO_Site: Kyiv: Saint-Sophia Cathedral and Related Monastic Buildings Kyiv-Pechersk Lavra
ACLED_Notes: On 30 October 2020, an unidentified individual attacked with a knife or a piece of glass a journalist near his house in Kiev and cut his face.

UNESCO_Site: Kyiv: Saint-Sophia Cathedral and Related Monastic Buildings Kyiv-Pechersk Lavra
ACLED_Notes: Security measures: On 9 December 2020, the government of Ukraine in Kiev enacted measures to limit the spread of coronavirus - including shutting down stores and other public places except those that sell food or medicine.

UNESCO_Site: Kyiv: Saint-Sophia Cathedral and Related Monastic Buildings Kyiv-Pechersk Lavra
ACLED_Notes: On 24 March 2021, unidentified persons abducted and killed in Kiev a veteran of the war in eastern Ukraine. The alleged reason could be that he was systematically combating raiders who were illegally occupying other people's flats in Kiev. Police started a criminal case.

UNESCO_Site: Kyiv: Saint-Sophia Cathedral and Related Monastic Buildings Kyiv-Pechersk Lavra
ACLED_Notes: Property destruction: On 18 April 2021, unknown individuals damaged the doors of the reception office of the Democratic Axe Party in Kiev and poured paint on them. The members of the Democratic Axe suspect that the provocation was organised by the president's adviser in response to criticism by party members of his activities.

UNESCO_Site: Kyiv: Saint-Sophia Cathedral and Related Monastic Buildings Kyiv-Pechersk Lavra
ACLED_Notes: On 18 May 2021, a police officer severely beat underage youths while detaining them in Kiev.

UNESCO_Site: Kyiv: Saint-Sophia Cathedral and Related Monastic Buildings Kyiv-Pechersk Lavra
ACLED_Notes: On 19 May 2021, police severely beat and detained an artist in Kiev. According to the victim, he had his nose smashed for no reason and was kept outside for several hours.

UNESCO_Site: Kyiv: Saint-Sophia Cathedral and Related Monastic Buildings Kyiv-Pechersk Lavra
ACLED_Notes: On 4 June 2021, unidentified individuals attacked the deputy chairman of the National Agency for Identifying, Tracing and Managing Assets Obtained through Corruption and Other Crimes in Kiev, when he was off duty. The victim sustained a gunshot wound.

UNESCO_Site: Kyiv: Saint-Sophia Cathedral and Related Monastic Buildings Kyiv-Pechersk Lavra
ACLED_Notes: Weapons seizure: On 18 June 2021, the Security Service of Ukraine seized a cache of weapons on the territory of the municipal enterprise Municipal Guard in Kiev, consisting of RPG-22 grenade launcher; 400 g of TNT, 2 cases of RGD-5 grenades, a U.S.-made KRISS semi-automatic pistol of 9*21 mm caliber, almost a hundred rounds of various calibers, a significant amount of hunting rifled weapons.

UNESCO_Site: Kyiv: Saint-Sophia Cathedral and Related Monastic Buildings Kyiv-Pechersk Lavra
ACLED_Notes: Property destruction: On 22 June 2021, unidentified individuals set fire to an activist's car in Kiev. The victim connects the arson to his activities against the illegal construction on the site of a park.

UNESCO_Site: Kyiv: Saint-Sophia Cathedral and Related Monastic Buildings Kyiv-Pechersk Lavra
ACLED_Notes: On 30 June 2021, unidentified individuals, allegedly far-right activists attacked and beat in Kiev a former Kharkiv separatist, who has several times avoided attending the trial for kidnapping during the Revolution of Dignity.

UNESCO_Site: Kyiv: Saint-Sophia Cathedral and Related Monastic Buildings Kyiv-Pechersk Lavra
ACLED_Notes: On 24 August 2021, an unidentified individual poured brilliant green [chemical desinfectant, Zelyonka] on former Ukrainian President Petro Poroshenko in Kiev. The victim was hospitalized with burns to his eyes.

UNESCO_Site: Kyiv: Saint-Sophia Cathedral and Related Monastic Buildings Kyiv-Pechersk Lavra
ACLED_Notes: Property destruction: On 26 August 2021, a man threw a Molotov cocktail at the entrance of the ombudsman's office in Kiev, as a result of which the doors of the premises were damaged. None of the workers and visitors was injured. Ombudsman believed that an NGO that opposes her work and position on equal rights of all citizens of Ukraine could be behind this incident. The attacker was detained.

UNESCO_Site: Kyiv: Saint-Sophia Cathedral and Related Monastic Buildings Kyiv-Pechersk Lavra
ACLED_Notes: On 30 September 2021, an unknown individual fired at the vehicle of a Head of the State Archive Service in Kiev who was not in the car at the moment of the attack. His driver was wounded in the incident and hospitalized.

UNESCO_Site: Kyiv: Saint-Sophia Cathedral and Related Monastic Buildings Kyiv-Pechersk Lavra

No casualties.

UNESCO_Site: Kyiv: Saint-Sophia Cathedral and Related Monastic Buildings Kyiv-Pechersk Lavra
ACLED_Notes: On 20 November 2024, Russian forces conducted a drone strike in Kyiv region, resulting in damage to a kindergarten, a school, three administrative buildings, two shops and agricultural machinery (coded to Kyiv, Kyiv). There were no casualties.

UNESCO_Site: Kyiv: Saint-Sophia Cathedral and Related Monastic Buildings Kyiv-Pechersk Lavra

ACLED_Notes: On 7 December 2024, Russian forces launched a Shahed drone strike at Kyiv region (coded to Kyiv, Kyiv region). While Ukrainian air defence forces intercepted drones, several houses and vehicles were damaged by the falling debris. No casualties.

UNESCO_Site: Kyiv: Saint-Sophia Cathedral and Related Monastic Buildings Kyiv-Pechersk Lavra

UNESCO_Site: Kyiv: Saint-Sophia Cathedral and Related Monastic Buildings Kyiv-Pechersk Lavra

UNESCO_Site: L'viv – the Ensemble of the Historic Centre
ACLED_Notes: Property destruction: On 3 February 2018, unidentified people set on fire a pro-Russian Orthodox church in Lviv - St Prince Volodymyr's Church of the Ukrainian Orthodox Church of the Moscow Patriarchate. The church sustained damage.

UNESCO_Site: L'viv – the Ensemble of the Historic Centre
ACLED_Notes: Property destruction: On 14 February 2018, an unidentified attacker set fire to a Russian bank branch office in Lviv. The man broke the window and threw a petrol bomb inside. The fire partially destroyed the property of the bank, but no-one was injured.

UNESCO_Site: L'viv – the Ensemble of the Historic Centre
ACLED_Notes: On 2 May 2018, after a lecture at a bookstore in Lviv, a JTO serviceman and an activist of the Ecological Platform organization, Rodion Bagaev, was beaten up by a group of six men belonging to ultraright groups. The attackers were identified as members of the National Corps Party and National Militia. According to other activists of the Ecological Platform, similar attacks by the same men happened before during other leftist events in Lviv.

UNESCO_Site: L'viv – the Ensemble of the Historic Centre
ACLED_Notes: On 23 June 2018, a group of masked far right men attacked a Roma camp near Lviv, Ukraine. The attackers killed one person, while four more, including a 10-year-old child, were hospitalized with stab wounds. Eight individuals were detained.

UNESCO_Site: L'viv – the Ensemble of the Historic Centre
ACLED_Notes: On 18 September 2018, in Lviv, 57 out of 84 regional councillors approved region-wide ban on Russian language.

UNESCO_Site: L'viv – the Ensemble of the Historic Centre
ACLED_Notes: On 28 November 2018, at night, unidentified individuals threw incendiary mixture into two separate offices of a Russian bank in Lviv. The buildings were damaged, no injuries were reported.

UNESCO_Site: L'viv – the Ensemble of the Historic Centre
ACLED_Notes: On 14 February 2019, two unidentified individuals broke the window of a Russian bank in Lviv and threw a bottle with incendiary mixture inside. The fire destroyed part of the room, no injuries were reported.

UNESCO_Site: L'viv – the Ensemble of the Historic Centre
ACLED_Notes: On 20 March 2019, unidentified individuals set fire to a branch office of a Russian private bank in Lviv. The office was partially damaged but no one was injured.

UNESCO_Site: L'viv – the Ensemble of the Historic Centre
ACLED_Notes: On 8 July 2019, in Lviv, guards of the public enterprise Ukrainian Association of the Blind beat an attorney who had been previously appointed as a head of the association. According to the victim, he was beaten for his previous legal work in revealing labour law violations and corruption in the association.

UNESCO_Site: L'viv – the Ensemble of the Historic Centre
ACLED_Notes: On 16 September 2019, unidentified individuals set fire to the front door of a flat of an employee of the mayor administration department of the city council in Lviv. No injuries were reported.

UNESCO_Site: L'viv – the Ensemble of the Historic Centre
ACLED_Notes: On 30 January 2020, at night, unidentified individuals set fire to a car of a Radio Free Europe journalist in Lviv. The car was destroyed, no injuries were reported.

UNESCO_Site: L'viv – the Ensemble of the Historic Centre
ACLED_Notes: Property destruction: On 10 June 2020, unidentified individuals broke into the yard of a journalist, the director-general of the NTA television channel and the Vholos media holding company in Lviv region, damaged his car and tried to break into his house but were stopped by the security system.

UNESCO_Site: L'viv – the Ensemble of the Historic Centre
ACLED_Notes: On 17 November 2020, three unidentified individuals attacked and severely beat two activists of veteran movement in Lviv. The attackers were detained by police.

UNESCO_Site: L'viv – the Ensemble of the Historic Centre
ACLED_Notes: On 19 November 2020, fifteen far right activists attacked and severely beat an eco-anarchist and anti-fascist in Lviv. The victim was hospitalized and had two surgeries.

UNESCO_Site: L'viv – the Ensemble of the Historic Centre
ACLED_Notes: Property destruction: On 17 December 2020, unidentified individuals set fire to a car of an employee of the National Anti-Corruption Bureau in Lviv. The car was destroyed, no injuries were reported. The victim claims that the arson is connected to his professional activities.

UNESCO_Site: L'viv – the Ensemble of the Historic Centre
ACLED_Notes: On 19 January 2021, unidentified people attacked an anti-fascist activist in Lviv. The attackers were armed with rubber truncheons, knives and hammers. This is the third attack on the victim, which he connects with his anti-fascist activities.

UNESCO_Site: L'viv – the Ensemble of the Historic Centre
ACLED_Notes: Weapons seizure: On 23 September 2021, the Security Service of Ukraine found and seized a cache of weapons in Lviv region, consisting of 2kg of plastic explosives, TNT bombs, explosive devices, three RG-42 and F-1 hand grenades, stun grenades, electric detonators, and more than 100 cartridges of 5.45mm calibre.

UNESCO_Site: L'viv – the Ensemble of the Historic Centre
ACLED_Notes: Weapons seizure: On 24 September 2021, the Security Service of Ukraine found and seized a cache of weapons on the private territory of an activist in Lviv region, consisting of 3 RG-42 and F-1 grenades, electric detonators, stun grenades, over 100 rounds of 5.45 millimeter ammunition.

UNESCO_Site: L'viv – the Ensemble of the Historic Centre
ACLED_Notes: Property destruction: On 24 December 2021, a man threw a Molotov cocktail at the building of the Russian consulate in Lviv, as a result of which the doors of the premises were damaged. None of the workers or visitors were injured.

UNESCO_Site: L'viv – the Ensemble of the Historic Centre
ACLED_Notes: On 18 March 2022, Russian air forces fired six guided X-555 missiles from the Black Sea into the aircraft repair factory in the Lviv airport in Lviv. Two missiles were intercepted. No fatalities, one person received injuries.

UNESCO_Site: L'viv – the Ensemble of the Historic Centre
ACLED_Notes: On 26 March 2022, the military forces of Russia shelled a fuel depot and industrial facility that repaired Ukrainian military equipment in Lviv, Lviv. Five people were wounded.

UNESCO_Site: L'viv – the Ensemble of the Historic Centre
ACLED_Notes: Interception: On 29 March 2022, Ukrainian forces destroyed two Russian missiles near Lviv. The missiles were launched from a Russian aircraft in Belarus.

ACLED_Notes: Displacement: On 11 April 2022, about 1000 orphans were evacuated to Lviv region from various eastern parts of the country.

ACLED_Notes: On 14 April 2022, a female human rights defender who worked with LGBTIQ persons and vulnerable women was tear gassed in the streets of Lviv by unidentified individuals while delivering humanitarian aid.

ACLED_Notes: Interception: On 16 April 2022, Ukrainian army destroyed four Russian missiles launched from planes SU-35 in Lviv region (coded to Lviv).

UNESCO_Site: L'viv – the Ensemble of the Historic Centre
ACLED_Notes: On 16 April 2022, Russian forces launched rocket and missile attacks on Lviv. Casualties unknown.

ACLED_Notes: On 18 April 2022, Russian forces launched a missile attack on Lviv, hitting military warehouses (although Ukrainian sources claimed that the warehouses were no longer used for military purposes) and a building of tire service. As a result, seven civilians were killed, eleven wounded.

ACLED_Notes: On 3 May 2022, Russian forces launched a rocket attack in Lviv. As a result of the shelling, two power substations were damaged and two people were wounded. There were no fatalities.

ACLED_Notes: On 23 November 2022, Russian forces launched a rocket strike at Lviv region (coded to Lviv, Lviv region) from Tu-95ms aircrafts, damaging a power distribution facility with 2 rockets and causing a blackout for 1.5 million people. Casualties unknown.

UNESCO_Site: L'viv – the Ensemble of the Historic Centre
ACLED_Notes: On 29 December 2022, Russian military forces launched missiles at two power stations in the Lviv region (coded to Lviv, Lviv). Other four missiles targeting the Lviv region were intercepted. Casualties unknown.

ACLED_Notes: On 5 December 2023, three Russian drones hit and damaged an infrastructure facility in Lviv Oblast (coded to Lviv, Lviv.) Casualties unknown.

ACLED_Notes: On 29 December 2023, Russian forces conducted a rocket attack on Lviv, Lviv. One civilian was killed, 30 others were wounded.

ACLED_Notes: On 29 December 2023, Russian forces launched drones and missiles at Lviv Oblast. Ukrainian forces shot down eight out of 14 drones and 10 out of 15 rockets.

ACLED_Notes: On 24 March 2024, Russian air forces carried out 7 drone strikes and launched 2 'Kinzhal' missiles at Lviv region (coded to Lviv). Ukrainian forces shot down Russian missiles and drones. Casualties unknown.

ACLED_Notes: Interception: On 29 March 2024, Ukrainian forces shot down 11 Russian drones over Lviv Oblast (coded to Lviv, Lviv.)

UNESCO_Site: L'viv – the Ensemble of the Historic Centre
ACLED_Notes: On 29 March 2024, Russian forces conducted missile strikes on and damaged a critical infrastructure object in Lviv Oblast (coded to Lviv, Lviv.)

ACLED_Notes: On 9 April 2024, Ukrainian Forces shot down UAVs of Russian Forces in the area of Lviv, Lviv. The debris from downed drones damaged a critical infrastructure facility. No casualties.

ACLED_Notes: On 19 June 2024, at night, Russian forces carried out drone strikes at unidentified targets in Lviv, Lviv. As a result, a research institute was damaged. Casualties unknown.

ACLED_Notes: On 22 June 2024, Russian air forces launched missiles at Lviv region (coded to Lviv). Ukrainian forces shot down Russian missiles. Casualties unknown.

ACLED_Notes: Interception: On 26 August 2024, Ukrainian military forces intercepted Russian missiles and drones over Lviv, Lviv. No casualties.
